definition: special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.english: It has peculiar character comparing with other interferometers.
sentences.chinese: 与其它干涉仪相比，具有独特的优点。

sentences.english: This book is suffused with Shaw's characteristic wry Irish humour.
sentences.chinese: 这本书充满了萧伯纳独特的爱尔兰式幽默与嘲讽。

sentences.english: The unique design and construction is what makes it so effective.
sentences.chinese: 它的显著效果来自其独特的设计及构造。

sentences.english: What Is Unique About the Program?
sentences.chinese: 蒙氏教学方法独特之处是什么？

sentences.english: A major highlight of the ceremony is a unique paper-cut fashion show.
sentences.chinese: 颁奖典礼上一大亮点就是独特的剪纸时装秀。

sentences.english: Is no substitute for showing off the core of her unique style.
sentences.chinese: 是否展露了无可取代的独特风格才是核心所在。

sentences.english: Fuxin Mongolian drama has a unique form of expression and the cultural charm.
sentences.chinese: 阜新蒙古剧有着独特的表现形式和文化魅力。

sentences.english: The 1010 Central store even has its own signature fragrance.
sentences.chinese: 1010中环店甚至还有自己的独特香氛。

sentences.english: This is the French unique humanities landscape, full of poetic.
sentences.chinese: 这是法国独特的人文景观，充满诗情画意。

sentences.english: Bonobos have developed a set of ritualized socio-sexual behaviors that are specific to their species.
sentences.chinese: 倭黑猩猩已经形成了一套自己独特的社交性行为。

sentences.english: Financial college students' quality education has its special inner regularity.
sentences.chinese: 财经类专业大学生的素质教育有其独特的内在规律性。

sentences.english: Regional and sub-regional organizations could play unique roles under the leadership of the United Nations. Financial support is important.
sentences.chinese: 区域和次区域组织可以在联合国领导下发挥独特作用。

sentences.english: In other words, learning spontaneously is one of man's unique traits.
sentences.chinese: 换言之，自动自发的学习是人类的独特性质之一。

sentences.english: Nanyang opera developed its own characteristics in its history.
sentences.chinese: 在长期的发展过程中，宛梆形成了独特的审美特征。

sentences.english: Each operating system makes its own unique demands on available memory resources.
sentences.chinese: 每个操作系统都有自己对可用内存资源的独特需求。

sentences.english: Tarpaulin, can be seen everywhere in China and is said not only very unique landscape.
sentences.chinese: 篷布，在中国不仅随处可见而且是道很独特的风景。

definition: to own exclusively/unique to/specific/there is only
to stand out from the masses (idiom)
having a unique or distinctive style
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
unique and unmatched (idiom); unrivalled/nothing compares with it
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
